result.execSummary:
The defendant Arnold C Gustafson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
Cases 22CF407, 22CF364, 22CF851 dismissed and read in. 
Defendant has 74 days credit if revoked from Probation. 
State does not object to probation ending after 2 years if there are no violations of conditions and the probation agent deems it appropriate.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with S.K., her residence or place of employment. 
Defendant not to be within one mile of Care Partners Assisted Living.
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: With Huber, all stayed pending further order of the court.

11:49 AM cases 22CF330, 22CF364, 22CF407, 22CF851 called. Defendant Arnold C Gustafson in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Arnold C Gustafson.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties stipulate to the competency report. Court finds defendant is competent to proceed. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defense recites the joint agreement. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to count 1 as charged in the Information. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 3 years with conditions: 
90 days in Jail with Huber all Stayed pending further order of the Court. 
No contact with S.K., her residence or place of employment. 
Defendant not to be within one mile of Care Partners Assisted Living. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant to pay court costs including DNA sample surcharge. 
State does not object to probation ending after 2 years if there are no violations of conditions and the probation agent deems it appropriate.

*CONFIDENTIAL*
by Sergio Sanchez, Psy.D., dated 09/20/2022

(9:14 AM cases 22CF330, 22CF364, 22CF407, 22CF851 called.) Defendant Arnold C Gustafson in court, in custody. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Arnold C Gustafson. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
State is objecting to any modification of bond and provides reasoning to the Court.
Attorney Rivard makes argument for bond modification.
State makes further argument in opposition of bond modification request.
Court orders the motion for bond modification is denied.
Cases will proceed for Competency Hearing as scheduled.

records.addlTxt: Competency hearing on September 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.

(2:02 PM cases 22CF330, 22CF364, 22CF407, 22CF851 called.) Defendant Arnold C Gustafson in court, in custody. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Arnold C Gustafson. Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rivard advises there had been an offer to conclude the 3 oldest cases but does not include the newest case.
Attorney Rivard advises there has been a competency examination ordered in Chippewa County for September 21, 2022.
Attorney Rivard is requesting a bail/bond hearing be scheduled.
Parties address competency and advise the exam in Chippewa County will not suffice for Eau Claire County cases.
State requests the Court order a competency examination be completed.
Attorney Rivard raises competency.
Court orders competency examination be completed.
Bail/Bond Hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 9:15 am.
Competency Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(Cases called at 3:46 PM - 22CF330, 22CF364, and 22CF407)
No appearance by Defendant Arnold Gustafson.  Attorney Francis Rivard appears.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was on a cash bond in Chippewa which was modified and a competency examination was ordered.  Attorney Rivard questions whether or not the Defendant can comprehend that he has a court hearing today.  Defense raises competency and notes that an examination will be performed in the Chippewa County cases - may be sufficient for the Eau Claire County cases.  Court cannot order a competency examination without the Defendant being present.
Status Conference: August 19, 2022 at 2:00 PM (In person)
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

(3:45 PM cases 22CF330, 22CF364, 22CF407 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom.  
Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Arnold C Gustafson appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Arnold C Gustafson.
Victim/Witness statute complied with.  
Defendant waives reading of Information in cases 22CF330, 22CF364, 22CF407 and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts, which are received by the Court.
Attorney Rivard requests to schedule a status conference.
Status Conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 3:45 pm.
Arraignment on June 9, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Same as Complaint.
